segments.text: The kitchen looks bright with that window open to the garden.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, totally zoned in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the sink—ugh, water everywhere, what a waste.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's flooding the floor and cabinets; so sloppy and unnecessary.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot's wet, and she doesn't even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids: boy's on that stool, hand in the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Stool's unstable, but they're ignoring it for treats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Girl's reaching up, like it's all fun and games.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Puddle's gross, slippery mess waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes piled up, probably dirty ones too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is clean and neat—why can't inside be?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Sneaking cookies while the place drowns; irresponsible.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just yucky.
segments.speaker: PAR
